summary: EcoPowerHub AI frontend (Vite/React) deployed to an Internet Computer asset canister; current work focuses on fixing/replacing corrupted full-color logo assets and updating the site header to use newly generated monochrome logos.
architectural_notes: Frontend is built with Vite and deployed to IC asset canister ecopowerhub_ai_assets (iovu4-biaaa-aaaam-qevxq-cai) accessible via https://iovu4-biaaa-aaaam-qevxq-cai.icp0.io/.
Static assets in frontend/public are served from the site root (e.g., public/logo-mono-white.png -> /logo-mono-white.png).
Logo assets are being generated/validated in WSL using ImageMagick (convert) and pngcheck before redeploy.
known_issues: logo-main.png (and decodes from logo-main-base64.txt) fails pngcheck with IHDR CRC error; ImageMagick cannot read it, blocking derivative logo generation from that source.
dfx deploy warns that no asset security policy is defined; .ic-assets.json5 should define a security_policy (or explicitly disable the warning).

existing_features.title: Update the authenticated app header logo to use the new monochrome logo files in `frontend/public` (`/logo-mono-white.png` for light mode and `/logo-mono-dark.png` for dark mode), and set the rendered logo height to 80px with automatic width.

Update the marketing site header logo to use the same new monochrome logo files (`/logo-mono-white.png` for light mode and `/logo-mono-dark.png` for dark mode) with a height of 80px and automatic width.

new_feature_requests.summary: Update App.tsx/header to use new monochrome logo assets from /public (e.g., /logo-mono-white.png and /logo-mono-dark.png), optionally supporting light/dark mode selection.
Improve/regenerate monochrome logo variants (v2) to better match original design (rings/text/spacing) using ImageMagick pipeline and deploy updated assets.
